gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.TwoD.Contour
Class ContourViewComponent

java.lang.Object
  gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.TwoD.Contour.ContourViewComponent
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPreserveState, IViewComponent, IViewComponent2D, java.io.Serializable
public class ContourViewComponent
extends java.lang.Object
implements IViewComponent2D, java.io.Serializable

This class is used to create a contour plot of a three dimensional set of data. The following features are supported:

  • Uniformly spaced contour levels
  • Manually entered contour levels
  • Contour labels
  • Formatting labels to a specified number of significant figures
  • Contour line styles (solid, dashed, dashed-dotted, or dotted).

See Also:
Serialized Form

MENU_HANDLER_KEY

public static final java.lang.String MENU_HANDLER_KEY
"Menu handler key" - This static constant String is a key used for referencing the state information for the ContourMenuHandler used by this component. The value that this key references is an ObjectState of a ContourMenuHandler.

Constructor Detail

ContourViewComponent

public ContourViewComponent(IVirtualArray2D arr)
Constructs this ViewComponent to use the given data. In addition, when the view is created the view controls will have the controls for the uniformly spaced contour levels displayed in the front tab of a tabbed pane. Also, the default line color (and not the default colorscale) will be used to color the contour plot.

Parameters:
arr - The data to be displayed by this ViewComponent.

setSelectedRegions

public void setSelectedRegions(Region[] rgn)
Given the array of selected regions a selection overlay with the selected regions can be made. Currently this method does nothing because this ViewComponent does not use a selection overlay.

Specified by:
setSelectedRegions in interface IViewComponent2D
Parameters:
rgn - An array of the selected regions.

getSelectedRegions

public Region[] getSelectedRegions()
Used to get the regions that are selected by the selection overlay.

Specified by:
getSelectedRegions in interface IViewComponent2D
Returns:
An array of the regions that are selected by the selection overlay. Currently, this method returns a zero element array because this ViewComponent does not use a selection overlay.

getColorScaleHandler

public ContourColorScaleHandler getColorScaleHandler()
Used to get access to the module that records how this ViewComponent's contour plot is being colored (i.e. with a colorscale or with a solid color).

Returns:
This ViewComponent's module that records if a colorscale is being used to color the contour plot.

getTestData

public static VirtualArray2D getTestData(int Nx,
                                         int Ny,
                                         double xRange,
                                         double yRange)
Creates a VirtualArray2D of test data that contains a peak.

Parameters:
Nx - The number of columns in the array. A good value is 41.
Ny - The number of rows in the array. A good value is 51.
xRange - The x range. A good value is 3.0.
yRange - The y range. A good value is 4.0.
Returns:
A virtual array of test data.

getTestDataArr

public static float[][] getTestDataArr(int Nx,
                                       int Ny,
                                       double xRange,
                                       double yRange)
Creates a float array array of test data.

Parameters:
Nx - The number of columns in the array. A good value is 41.
Ny - The number of rows in the array. A good value is 51.
xRange - The x range. A good value is 3.0.
yRange - The y range. A good value is 4.0.
Returns:
A float[][] containing test data.

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Testbed. Displays this view along with its controls and menu items. This method just invokes ComponentViewManager.main(args).

Parameters:
args - Unused.
